collectors.name: Get-DocumentLinks
collectors.description: Extracts hyperlinks from Office documents (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and PDFs with location context and link classification
collectors.description_extended: Identifies hardcoded file paths, external URLs, email links, and relative references embedded in document content. Uses Open XML SDK (built-in) for Office formats and ZIP relationship parsing. Essential for understanding document dependencies during file share migration and identifying potential broken references.

output.Links: array of {Url, LinkType, Context, SourceFile, IsInternal}

collectors.name: Test-DocumentLinks
collectors.description: Validates extracted links by testing HTTP accessibility, file path existence, UNC shares, and email format. Includes intelligent caching and risk scoring.
collectors.description_extended: Tests each unique link for reachability. HTTP/HTTPS links tested via Invoke-WebRequest. File paths tested via Test-Path. Results cached 24 hours to avoid redundant validation. Risk scores CRITICAL (broken external URLs), HIGH (invalid file paths), MEDIUM (timeout), LOW (valid).

output.Summary: object with counts by risk level and validity status

collectors.name: Invoke-DocumentLinkAudit
collectors.description: End-to-end orchestration: enumerate documents, extract links, validate, and generate executive reports with migration risk assessment
collectors.description_extended: High-level wrapper combining extraction and validation into a single audit run. Enumerates documents recursively, deduplicates links across files, validates in parallel, and generates JSON/CSV/HTML reports. Perfect for MSP document readiness assessments.

outputs.JSON: Complete audit data with extraction and validation results
outputs.CSV: Broken links list (only if issues found)
outputs.HTML: Executive dashboard with metrics, risk distribution, broken links table

schema.description: Collector metadata schema for ServerAuditToolkitV2. Enables version-aware, performance-optimized collector selection with execution timing and timeout management.

fields.name: Unique collector identifier (used in Invoke-ServerAudit -Collectors parameter)
fields.description: Brief description of what this collector discovers
fields.filename: Primary filename for this collector (base variant)
fields.category: Classification: core, infrastructure, application, or compliance
fields.psVersions: Array of PowerShell versions that support this collector
fields.maxWindowsVersion: Maximum Windows Server version (null = no upper limit)
fields.dependencies: Required Windows features or modules (RSAT, WebAdministration, etc.)
fields.timeout: Max execution time in seconds for this collector
fields.estimatedExecutionTime: Typical execution time in seconds (for planning)
fields.criticalForMigration: Whether data from this collector is essential for migration decisions
fields.variants: Optimized implementations for specific PowerShell versions (e.g., PS5, PS7)

executionNotes.businessHoursCutoff: Stop execution 1 hour before 8:00 AM (configurable in audit-config.json)
executionNotes.timeoutBehavior: Collectors exceeding timeout are stopped gracefully; audit continues with remaining collectors
executionNotes.errorHandling: Failed collectors are logged but do not halt execution (continueOnError: true)
